input_text:
Job Title: Senior Project Manager

Location: Portland, OR

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Information Technology, Project Management

Description:
Industry You Will Work In

Opportunity to support heavy industrial projects in Pulp & Paper, Oil & Gas, Renewable Energies, and Petrochemical industries

Your Responsibilities Will Be

Successfully manage small to large projects ($10,000 to $1,000,000 engineering budgets).Lead and direct a multi-discipline team of engineers & designers to meet customer objectives.Estimate costs of completing projects that encompass multiple-disciplines engineering costs and total installed construction cost including equipment, subcontractors reimbursable expenses, and other related costs.Manage project schedules, scopes, budgets and provide project status reports to clients and leadership.Project development from concept through construction including start-up and commissioning.

Your Experience Should Include

8+ years of combined experience working as a Project Engineer or Project Manager on industrial projects. (Oil & Gas, refinery, pulp & paper etc.) P.E. (Professional Engineer) is desired; must be willing to work toward and obtain a PE if license is not currently held. B.S. (Bachelor of Science) in Engineering is required - mechanical, electrical, civil or chemical engineering degree is preferredProficiency with PDF markup software (Bluebeam Revu or Adobe Acrobat) is preferred.Familiarity with Microsoft Project or a similar tool is strongly preferred.Experience with Navisworks Freedom is preferred.Basic knowledge of CAD software terminology, methods, and practices; ability to operate CAD software is not required.

**This will be a remote position and we would prefer to have someone that lives in the Northwest part of the country**

About Actalent

Actalent is a global leader in engineering and sciences services and talent solutions. We help visionary companies advance their engineering and science initiatives through access to specialized experts who drive scale, innovation and speed to market. With a network of almost 30,000 consultants and more than 4,500 clients across the U.S., Canada, Asia and Europe, Actalent serves many of the Fortune 500.

Diversity, Equity & Inclusion

At Actalent, Diversity And Inclusion Are a Bridge Towards The Equity And Success Of Our People. DE&I Are Embedded Into Our Culture Through

Hiring diverse talentMaintaining an inclusive environment through persistent self-reflectionBuilding a culture of care, engagement, and recognition with clear outcomesEnsuring growth opportunities for our people

The company is an equal opportunity employer and will consider all applications without regard to race, sex, age, color, religion, national origin, veteran status, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information or any characteristic protected by law.

If you would like to request a reasonable accommodation, such as the modification or adjustment of the job application process or interviewing process due to a disability, please email actalentaccommodation@actalentservices.com for other accommodation options.

Experience Level (if available): Mid-Senior level

output_json.title: Senior Project Manager
output_json.summary: Support heavy industrial projects in Pulp & Paper, Oil & Gas, Renewable Energies, and Petrochemical industries.
optional_skills: CAD software terminology, methods, and practices
job_responsibilities: Manage small to large projects with engineering budgets ranging from $10,000 to $1,000,000.
Lead and direct a multi-discipline team of engineers & designers.
Estimate project costs including equipment, subcontractors, and other related expenses.
Manage project schedules, scopes, and budgets.
Provide project status reports to clients and leadership.
Develop projects from concept through construction, including start-up and commissioning.
output_json.company_information: Actalent is a global leader in engineering and sciences services and talent solutions.
